question: Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways identified routes for inland and international waterways under which scheme?
explanation:
Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways (MoPSW) has recently identified domestic locations including Hazira, Somnath Temple, Mumbai/JNPT, Jamnagar, Kochi, Goa, among others, for beginning ferry services through inland waterways.
Also, six international routes, connecting 4 international destinations including Chattogram (Bangladesh), Seychelles (East Africa), from Indian major coastal port towns are identified. The locations are identified under Sagarmala programme.
